text:
Hello everyone. This is Minoo at 
Anglo-Link.
Welcome to Lesson 9 in my EZEE series,
where we will be eliminating some more common mistakes
to boost your confidence in using English.
Remember that English is not an easy language to master,
so don't aim for perfection and relax about mistakes.
In today's lesson, we're going to clear up the confusion
that the words 'little', 'a little', 'few', and 'a few'  create for many of us.
It is pretty amazing that 'I have a few friends.'
and 'I have few friends.' almost mean the opposite things,
so let's go over to the slides

to clarify the correct usage of these
four quantifiers.

Well, that is the end of Lesson 9. I
hope I have managed to clear up the

confusion that surrounds
these four words.
For a complete lesson on these and other quantifiers, visit my YouTube channel and look for the video 'Quantifiers',
or use the link at the end of this video.

Remember to also explore my self-study
course

that offers a complete series of grammar,
conversation, and pronunciation lessons.

To join my online course, simply visit my website
anglo-link.com.
And also please make sure to subscribe to my channel and allow notifications
to know when my next lesson is online.
Thank you for joining me for this lesson,

and I'll see you again soon.
Goodbye for now.
